basics.name: Angelina Abitino
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am an engineer interested in the advancement of safe and equitable machine learning systems. When I'm not coding you might find me cooking, making pottery, or taking pictures of the people and places around me. Click the tumblr link below for a look at my photography portfolio.

highlights: Developed extraction, transformation, and load processes to import large scale claims data into SQL server databases
Designed queries to validate data in non-production environments
Streamlined and managed claims import projects for healthcare organizations
Awarded grant from National Science Foundation to engage in lifelong learning research for Research Experiences for Undergraduates
Conducted systematic literature review on proposed methods to reduce catastrophic forgetting in deep neural networks
Designed and implemented experiments to evaluate and compare mitigation methods with Python using Keras, and Tensorflow libraries
Co-authored paper accepted into 2018 Conference on Artificial Intelligence

work.company: Swarthmore College Office of Student Engagement
highlights: Responsible for a dormitory housing 48 students
General resource and counselor for the student body
Liaison between students and the administration
Photographed campus events and edited media for official college social media and quarterly publication, the Swarthmore College Bulletin
Graded coursework for Digital Systems and Computer Engineering Fundamentals, as well as Design of Digital and Embedded Systems

publications.name: Measuring Catastrophic Forgetting in Neural Networks
publications.author: Kemker, R., McClure, M., Abitino, A., Hayes, T., Kanan, C.
publications.publisher: Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence 2018
